page.title: 09A Cockermouth Stick Dresser
page.content: {Mr G Mossop,}a retired post office telephone worker, makes walking sticks for farmers and shepherds.The main part of the stick is the straight length of hazel or black thorn. He has to leave the wood for 2 years so that it can season.The handle is made of {Herdwick}or{Swaledale}sheep's horn.It needs to be boiled for 20 minutes before he can bend it.A short metal tube is put on the bottom of the stick so that the wood can't wear away.So that he can shape the handle he needs to steam it with a kettle.To smooth down the horn he uses files and emery paper.The wire wool he rubs on the horn to make smooth.Mostly dogs,foxes and fishes are carved onto the sticks handle.There are competit- ions for the best sticks at the {agricultural shows,}for example the Loweswater Show.
